revealed_symptoms.shiny or waxy bump: It looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away.
revealed_symptoms.evolving: This thing keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before.
revealed_symptoms.telangiectasia: There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before.
revealed_symptoms.hyperkeratosis: There's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels.
revealed_symptoms.spontaneous bleeding: Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.
revealed_symptoms.nodule formation: It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles.
revealed_symptoms.diameter >6mm: It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing.
revealed_symptoms.satellite lesions: There are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.

hidden_symptoms.asymmetry: One side of this mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven.
hidden_symptoms.rapid growth: I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks.
hidden_symptoms.pruritus: It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.
hidden_symptoms.color variation: It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.

interaction_metadata.diagnosis: Suspicious skin lesion (possible melanoma or other skin cancer)

patient_history.content: Hi, I'll be your doctor today. What brings you in?

Well, I’ve got this thing on my skin that looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away. It’s also been changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before. And around the spot, there are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels that I didn’t notice before. Plus, there's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels. Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it. It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles. It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing. And there are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.
Thank you for providing that detailed information. Based on your description, I'd like to ask about whether you have felt any pain or tenderness in the skin lesion or around it.
No, I haven’t noticed any pain or tenderness.
Thank you. Now, can you tell me about your history of sun exposure? Have you spent a lot of time in the sun, either for work or recreation, over the years? Have you ever used tanning beds?
I have spent quite a bit of time in the sun over the years, for fun and sometimes for work, but I haven't used tanning beds.
Thank you. Now, let's talk about your family history. Does anyone in your family have a history of skin cancer?
Okay. Have you noticed any swelling in the lymph nodes near the skin lesion, such as in your armpit or neck?
No, I haven’t noticed any swelling.

doctor_history.content: Well, I’ve got this thing on my skin that looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away. It’s also been changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before. And around the spot, there are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels that I didn’t notice before. Plus, there's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels. Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it. It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles. It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing. And there are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.
